item.title: Student of the Month Trophy
item.author: wick2o@gmail.com (Jaime 'WiK' Filson)
item.description: My son volunteered to design and produce a “Student of the Month” trophy for his 6th grade class.

item.title: DEFCON Smiley
item.author: wick2o@gmail.com (Jaime 'WiK' Filson)
item.description: I released my model on thingiverse today. Check it out HERE Enjoy!

item.title: SECTF Submission 2015
item.author: wick2o@gmail.com (Jaime 'WiK' Filson)
item.description: This year at DEFCON I thought I would try my hand at the Social Engineering CTF. Not only do you have to raise your hand and and go ‘pick me! pick me!', you also must submit a short video for their review.

item.title: BSidesDE Spawncamp and My Spawn
item.author: wick2o@gmail.com (Jaime 'WiK' Filson)
item.description: A few weeks ago while attending BSidesDC I found out that BSidesDE was planning a kids event this year. The moment my kids heard the word minecraft all bets went out of the window and they just HAD to be there.

item.title: A Shapeoko Vacuum Table Design
item.author: wick2o@gmail.com (Jaime 'WiK' Filson)
item.description: I was trying to cut out some shapes from some 1/16” thick acrylic the other day when after a few cuts the material seemed to be lifted by the drill. The cutout part would also start to move as the drill reached the end of its travel. This is when it hit me, having a vacuum table would sure be nice!

item.title: NoVA Hackers DEFCON 22 Badges
item.author: wick2o@gmail.com (Jaime 'WiK' Filson)
item.description: The NoVA Hackers is an infosec group from the northern Virginia DC area. As a member I thought it was time we had our own DEFCON style badges while in Vegas (much like many of the other infosec groups). It was just a random idea that the rest of the group loved, so over the past 8 months it has been a constant off again and on again project.

item.title: Blackhat Training 2014 Review
item.author: wick2o@gmail.com (Jaime 'WiK' Filson)
item.description: This year I had some extra money burning a hole in my pocket and right away I thought Blackhat Training. This year I had the pleasure of taking the Advanced Practical Social Engineering class by Social-Engineer, Inc.

item.title: farewell gitdigger
item.author: wick2o@gmail.com (Jaime 'WiK' Filson)
item.description: It’s with great regret that I need to shutdown the hardware and say goodbye to my gitdigger project. There are a few reasons and I will try and address them in this post.

item.title: octopress update
item.author: wick2o@gmail.com (Jaime 'WiK' Filson)
item.description: After DEF CON I thought it would be wise to maybe blog about my Vegas antics and the classes I attended. I also thought it would be a smart idea to update octopress. The former was a good idea; the latter caused my site to die. I’ve rebuilt everything from scratch with the latest and greatest so if you notice any errors on the site please let me know. Thank you!

item.title: python-graphviz: A New Way of Looking At The Data of Things
item.author: wick2o@gmail.com (Jaime 'WiK' Filson)
item.description: At my new job (and some of my personal projects) I found myself looking at a ton of text. Upon reviewing all this data, which could be anything from json, csv or just plain text, my eyes tend to bleed. It can quite quickly become confusion as to which data I’ve looked at or how that data relates to everything else.

item.title: Reviewing The Hacker Playbook
item.author: wick2o@gmail.com (Jaime 'WiK' Filson)
item.description: The Hacker Playbook was written by Peter Kim. You can find it on Amazon in Paperback and Kindle versions HERE.

item.title: Reviewing RTFM - Red Team Field Manual
item.author: wick2o@gmail.com (Jaime 'WiK' Filson)
item.description: RTFM: Red Team Field Manual was written by Ben Clark. You can find it on Amazon in Paperback version HERE.

item.title: Using NSIS to create an auto installer
item.author: wick2o@gmail.com (Jaime 'WiK' Filson)
item.description: NSIS (Nullsoft Scriptable Install System) is a professional open source system to create Windows installers. You can download NSIS from the main website HERE.

item.title: Reviewing Unmasking the Social Engineer
item.author: wick2o@gmail.com (Jaime 'WiK' Filson)
item.description: Unmasking the Social Engineer was written by Christopher Hadnagy at social-engineer.com. He takes the research from Paul Ekman, PH.D. and applies it to the human element of security. You can find it on Amazon in both Kindle and Paperback versions HERE.

item.title: Installing edb debugger on Ubuntu
item.author: wick2o@gmail.com (Jaime 'WiK' Filson)
item.description: First lets start by installing the needed packages.

item.title: Fun with Shapeoko
item.author: wick2o@gmail.com (Jaime 'WiK' Filson)
item.description: I’ve been looking for a micro project to get some use out of my Shapeoko. What’s more fun then a 5.25 floppy disk coaster?

item.title: The Everyday Carry Handcuff Key
item.author: wick2o@gmail.com (Jaime 'WiK' Filson)
item.description: This is a very small inconspicuous handcuff key I found in one of my RSS feeds. I’m not sure why, but I had to check them out. I like the small footprint and it clips nicely on a belt loop or on the webbing of my daily carry bag. I don’t like that it’s made of stainless steel; it’s something that you could easily forget about while going through a metal detector.

item.title: How to handle multiple github accounts
item.author: wick2o@gmail.com (Jaime 'WiK' Filson)
item.description: I’ve always just worked with one GitHub account (my personal one), and then came octopress. I wanted to convert all the sites I manage from WordPress to octopress. Everything went well until running rake deploy.

item.title: Shapeoko 2 Build Notes
item.author: wick2o@gmail.com (Jaime 'WiK' Filson)
item.description: Today I completed my Shapeoko 2 build. Following the instuctions on their wiki was pretty straight forward. There are a few key items I will share in case you order one yourself.

item.title: Shapeoko 2 Has Arrived!
item.author: wick2o@gmail.com (Jaime 'WiK' Filson)
item.description: Today my Shapeoko 2 has arrived. For those who don’t know what this is; it’s a desktop CNC Mill from Inventables. I’ve put about 1/3rd of it together so far. Pictures and what I do with it may be posted in the future.

item.title: How to get your iPhone 5s to show up in iTunes
item.author: wick2o@gmail.com (Jaime 'WiK' Filson)
item.description: Tonight I was asked why someones iPhone 5 (or maybe it was a 5s) didn’t show up in iTunes. Luckly they had their laptop with them. The OS was Windows 8 so your milage may vary.

item.title: New Year Haunted Adventure
item.author: wick2o@gmail.com (Jaime 'WiK' Filson)
item.description: This year the wife and I stayed at a Haunted B&B and did 2 ghost hunts. We’ve never done either before and it sounded like. The “hunts” were fun, walking around a haunted location with some other people and using the equipment then you see on all the ghost shows. I bought a small voice recorder while out and about to leave running in the room while we slept.

item.title: Why yes, I would like that as a kindle book
item.author: wick2o@gmail.com (Jaime 'WiK' Filson)
item.description: I got a bit tired of not finding that one IT book I wanted in kindle format. The following script will go thought Amazon’s IT Books and auto check the link to request a kindle version. Warning, This was a quick and dirty solution. Your mileage may vary.

item.title: Android Tools in Kali + Raspbian
item.author: wick2o@gmail.com (Jaime 'WiK' Filson)
item.description: How I got Android Tools working in Kali and Raspbian

item.title: Stopping a small botnet
item.author: wick2o@gmail.com (Jaime 'WiK' Filson)
item.description: Today I woke up to an unresponsive website. When I started to look at the Apache access.log file I found a ton of IPs trying to bruteforce my wp-admin.php creds. I knew they weren’t going to get anywhere (thank you google auth), but it was doing a good job at DDOS.

item.title: gitrecon
item.author: wick2o@gmail.com (Jaime 'WiK' Filson)
item.description: I was on hacker hotshots today. I was asked: Will any of the code make it into Kali?. It didn’t even occur to me that some of the code I’m using would be useful to others. After a few moments of thought ‘gitrecon’ was born.

item.title: Raspberry Pi: Call Screening
item.author: wick2o@gmail.com (Jaime 'WiK' Filson)
item.description: Lets get our call sceening on with our Raspberry Pi.

item.title: Raspberry Pi: Preseeding
item.author: wick2o@gmail.com (Jaime 'WiK' Filson)
item.description: I have been playing around with multiple projects on a Raspberry Pi and got tired of answering the install questions over and over again. I’m going to assume you know how to do a default install of Raspbian using the installer.

item.title: iOS Google Authenticator Screw Up
item.author: wick2o@gmail.com (Jaime 'WiK' Filson)
item.description: If you have not heard the news, Google screwed up their iphone app. If you were unlucky (like i was) and updated to the latest version it wiped all of your accounts. I didn’t get hit too hard, I only lost access to two WordPress blogs. Below is how I quickly fixed it.

item.title: Review: Grid-it
item.author: wick2o@gmail.com (Jaime 'WiK' Filson)
item.description: This is the perfect item for your redteamer (or toy) bag. All the little gadgets that normally just flop around on the bottom of my bag are now neatly in one place, and I can find them in a hurry.

item.title: Raspberry Pi: OpenVPN
item.author: wick2o@gmail.com (Jaime 'WiK' Filson)
item.description: This is the story of how I got my Raspberry Pi to be my OpenVPN Server. I am using Raspbian as my Pi OS.

item.title: Splinter Test Framework
item.author: wick2o@gmail.com (Jaime 'WiK' Filson)
item.description: Splinter is an open source tool for testing web applications using Python. It lets you automate browser actions, such as visiting URLs and interacting with their itemcts..

item.title: Joyland
item.author: wick2o@gmail.com (Jaime 'WiK' Filson)
item.description: This is a great story about a young man who takes a summer job at a carny, leaves school, solves a crime with a ghost twist that only Stephen King can come up with. I loved it. Go pick it up at Amazon.com

item.title: The Professional Thief
item.author: wick2o@gmail.com (Jaime 'WiK' Filson)
item.description: This book was written by researching and talking with a professional thief. The slang and mentality is from the 1900s. My initial thoughts were not very favorable when I was about 60 pages into the book. I couldn’t see what information I could get out of the book that wanted covered in the movie/play Oliver or the more relevant BBC show hustle. I’m not one to put down a book I’ve set to read so I carried on.

item.author: wick2o@gmail.com (Jaime 'WiK' Filson)
item.description: Let’s be honest, I’m not sure what to write here.

item.title: Résumé
item.author: wick2o@gmail.com (Jaime 'WiK' Filson)
item.description: Resume in docx HERE.Resume in pdf HERE.ProfileExperienced professional seeking further challenges where a diverse technical background will be utilized while learning new technologies. ExperienceResearch Engineer: December 2014 - PresentSourceFire (Columbia, MD) Senior Research Engineer: March 2014 - November 2014CounterTack, Inc (Santa Monica, CA) Using Python to automate common tasks for co-workers. Creating demos for sales staff to help demonstrate the company’s product. Modifying existing malware to bypass multiple anti-virus vendors.
